meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Emily Waltenbaugh Amy Nienaber Clay Walls Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6804.

td.p: Emily Waltenbaugh, a library volunteer coordinator from Nashville, Tennessee
Amy Nienaber, an aspiring student from Bettendorf, Iowa
Clay Walls, a university honors program manager from Birmingham, Alabama (whose 1-day cash winnings total $7,199)

tr.td: NURSERY RHYMES
COLLEGE FOOTBALL COACHES
UNITS OF MEASURE
MORGAN TOWN
FEUDS
THE 1-SYLLABLE WORD

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '"Hey Diddle Diddle"

Clay
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'It\'s the nursery rhyme that says, "the cow jumped over the moon"; in the military it precedes "straight up the middle"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

(Alex: Okay, we only need the title.)
(Amy: Oh.)
(Alex: But you gave us the title included.)
(Amy: I\'m sorry.)
(Alex: That\'s all right. Don\'t be sorry. You got it right.)

"When I\'m Sixty-Four"

Amy
')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Clay] "I swear by Apollo the physician" is how it begins.)
ClayWhat is the Hippocratic oath?
$0
EmilyWhat is the oath of office?
$7,050
AmyWhat is the Hippocratic oath?
$3,800
the Hippocratic Oath')

tr.td: ADAPTED FROM ANTIQUITY
It begins with a vow to an ancient god & ends with "if I transgress it & swear falsely, may the opposite of all this be my lot"
Clay
Amy
Emily
3rd place: $1,000
New champion: $21,000
2nd place: $2,000
Clay
Amy
Emily

(including 1 DD),
